q: networks statement Thursday, Google's Eric Schmidt , announced that he will hand over the title of chief executive to Google co-founder Larry Page in April. In a message sent out on Twitter, Eric Schmidt said: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed! Eric Schmidt , a tech industry veteran who was brought in 10 years ago to provide what some at the company called ''adult supervision'' for Google's young founders, will take on the role of executive chairman,

Donald Rumsfeld of Defense after Abu Ghraib- twice. President Bush refused to accept both times, keeping Donald Rumsfeld on at the Pentagon, where he turned into a lightning rod for criticism of the invasion and occupation of Iraq. In an exclusive interview with ABC's Diane Sawyer , Donald Rumsfeld also said the enhanced interrogation techniques he approved for use on the so-called ''20th hijacker- including forced stress positions and removal of ''comfort items''- produced invaluable intelligence.'' But his biggest regret was staying in office during what he calls a period of ''damaging distraction,''

By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, he said in the statement. Brad Shanks , the manager and promoter of the Jackpot, realizes the need to bring in larger shows while keeping a local feel. We are a middle-of-the-road venue for the more underground and independent bands. We do our own promoting for touring bands, but we like a good mix, Brad Shanks said. chief executive in a surprising management reshuffling announced with the Internet company's fourth-quarter earnings, which jumped 29%. The Mountain View, Calif., company said the moves, effective April 4, were made to streamline decision-making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt will no longer be responsible for the day-to-day operations. Instead, he will become exective chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. room for co-founder Larry Page, a role he will start in on April 4th. ''In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly,'' wrote Eric Schmidt . This project is the first tangible example of the benefits brought by the Chrysler alliance to Italian operations and it is significant that it should take place at Mirafiori, the symbol of this nation's industrial and automotive culture, Fiat said in late November, when most of the Mirafiori unions signalled they would support Mr. Sergio Marchionne 's factory overhaul plan.
